markdown:
Created from the exoskeleton of a [giant stag beetle](/Monsters.aspx?ID=50), this mindless husk can cut a foe in half using its powerful mandibles. The abdomen of this crawling undead is empty, and more than one necromancer has used this space to hide valuable cargo. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 22 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 [Beetle Carapace](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1902) **Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 148 **Perception** +12; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +11, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +15 **Str** +5 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** -5 **Wis** +2 **Cha** -2 --- **AC** 25 **Fort** +16 **Ref** +13 **Will** +10 **HP** 90 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) 5, [electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56) 5, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 5, piercing 5, slashing 5 --- **Speed** 20 feet, fly 20 feet **Melee** mandible +15, **Damage** 2d8+7 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Melee** foot +15, **Damage** 2d6+7 bludgeoning **Abdomen Cache** The abdomen of a beetle carapace can be fitted with a simple hinge, allowing it to open and be used as storage. The abdomen can hold up to one Medium or smaller creature, a Large or smaller swarm, or a similar amount of cargo. The beetle or a creature stored in it can Interact to open the hatch. If the beetle carapace takes a critical hit by a bludgeoning weapon, roll a DC 10 flat check. If the check fails, the cache is breached, and its contents spill out of the beetle. The hatch can also be [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=34) (DC 22 [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3)). **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** 2d8+2 piercing, DC 24
Crawling Cargo Undead make for the most common passengers inside a beetle carapace's abdomen, but swarms often pack tight inside the creatures. Insects tend to be more comfortable around undead than other types of animals. The following creatures make good options for combat encounters, in which they can be released at a dramatic moment for a grotesque surprise. **Bestiary**: [Centipede swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=78), [scorpion swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=357), [wasp swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=406)
**Bestiary 2**: [Army ant swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=549), [fen mosquito swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=732), [sportlebore swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=816)
**Bestiary 3**: [Bore worm swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1083), [clacking skull swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1307), [hellwasp swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1191), [hermit crab swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1106)
name: Beetle Carapace

text: Beetle Carapace Created from the exoskeleton of a giant stag beetle, this mindless husk can cut a foe in half using its powerful mandibles. The abdomen of this crawling undead is empty, and more than one necromancer has used this space to hide valuable cargo. The abdomen can hold up to one Medium or smaller creature, a Large or smaller swarm, or a similar amount of cargo. The beetle or a creature stored in it can Interact to open the hatch. If the beetle carapace takes a critical hit by a bludgeoning weapon, roll a DC 10 flat check. If the check fails, the cache is breached, and its contents spill out of the beetle. The hatch can also be Force Open (DC 22 Athletics). Constrict Single Action 2d8+2 piercing, DC 24 Crawling Cargo Undead make for the most common passengers inside a beetle carapace's abdomen, but swarms often pack tight inside the creatures. Insects tend to be more comfortable around undead than other types of animals. The following creatures make good options for combat encounters, in which they can be released at a dramatic moment for a grotesque surprise. Bestiary : Centipede swarm, scorpion swarm, wasp swarm Bestiary 2 : Army ant swarm, fen mosquito swarm, sportlebore swarm Bestiary 3 : Bore worm swarm, clacking skull swarm, hellwasp swarm, hermit crab swarm
